title: Go Tour slide #61 has misleading struct/member names
body:
by **ohookins**: 
Sorry if this is not the right place to notify you of this problem, but it is somewhat
hard to figure out where website issues should be directed to.

Here is the offending slide:
http://tour.golang.org/#61

Notice that the struct member for the io.Reader is called "r", and also the
struct name itself in the Read() function defined on it is "r". This is not
helpful for someone who is just getting started with the language. It is all too easy to
misunderstand the nature of this problem and end up calling r.Read(), which of course
ends up in an infinite loop.

It would be far more helpful to someone learning the language to have different names
for these two entities, preferably more than a single character long (but just making
them different in the first place would make the biggest difference).
